SEARCH
Package wtf.file.api.data

Schnittstelle Frame

Alle bekannten Unterschnittstellen:
EditableFrame, EditableWtfImage, WtfImage
public interface Frame
Represents a single image frame consisting of a 2D array of Pixel values.

A frame can be accessed programmatically by individual pixel coordinates or retrieved as a full Java Image object for rendering or export.

  • Methodenübersicht

    Modifizierer und Typ
    Methode
    Beschreibung
    Image
    asJavaImage()
    Converts the frame into a standard Java Image object.
    Pixel
    at(int x, int y)
    Returns the Pixel at the specified (x, y) coordinate.
    Pixel[][]
    pixels()
    Retrieves the 2D array of pixels that make up the frame.

  • Methodendetails

    • pixels

      Pixel[][] pixels()
      Retrieves the 2D array of pixels that make up the frame.
      Gibt zurück:
      a two-dimensional array of Pixel objects.

    • at

      Pixel at(int x, int y) throws NumberOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the Pixel at the specified (x, y) coordinate.
      Parameter:
      x - the horizontal (column) position, starting from 0.
      y - the vertical (row) position, starting from 0.
      Gibt zurück:
      the Pixel at the given coordinate.
      Löst aus:
      NumberOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are outside the frame dimensions.

    • asJavaImage

      Image asJavaImage()
      Converts the frame into a standard Java Image object. For this every pixel gets transformed into a ColorSpace.RGB pixel}, ColorSpace.RGBa or ColorSpace.DYNAMIC_RGBa with a channel width of 8 bits (0-255 values). Thus information may get lost.
      Gibt zurück:
      the Image representation of this frame.
